message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.DC, cs.SY

Reasoning: The paper discusses the design and performance evaluation of a random access communication system in DVB-RCS2, which involves network protocols, information theory, multimedia systems, distributed computing, and system engineering. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.MM (Multimedia), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), and cs.SY (Systems and Control).
